name: Github Capabilities
description: Evaluation dataset for GitHub subagent capabilities including PRs, issues, commits, and repository operations

items.input: Create a pull request from my latest feature branch into develop with a proper description.
items.expected_output: Pull request created successfully from feature branch to develop with description.
items.context: User wants to create a PR merging their feature work into the develop branch

items.input: Show me all open pull requests that haven't been reviewed yet.
items.expected_output: List of open pull requests without reviews displayed.
items.context: User wants to see PRs pending review

items.input: Request reviews from aryanranderiya on the PR I just opened.
items.expected_output: Review requests sent to Aryan on the pull request.
items.context: User wants to request reviews from specific team members

items.input: List all files changed in PR #4 and summarize what areas were touched.
items.expected_output: List of changed files in PR #4 with summary of affected areas.
items.context: User wants to understand the scope of changes in a specific PR

items.input: Add a review comment asking for tests on the database changes in the PR.
items.expected_output: Review comment added requesting tests for database changes.
items.context: User wants to add a specific review comment about testing

items.input: Merge the PR using squash merge if it's mergeable.
items.expected_output: Pull request merged using squash merge.
items.context: User wants to merge PR with squash strategy

items.input: List all commits included in this pull request.
items.expected_output: List of commits in the pull request displayed.
items.context: User wants to see commit history for a PR

items.input: Create an issue for a login bug and assign it to aryanranderiya.
items.expected_output: Issue created for login bug and assigned to auth owner.
items.context: User wants to create and assign an issue to the right person

items.input: Add a 'bug' and 'high priority' label to the issue.
items.expected_output: Labels 'bug' and 'high priority' added to the issue.
items.context: User wants to categorize and prioritize an issue

items.input: Lock this issue since it's resolved and discussions are getting noisy.
items.context: User wants to prevent further comments on resolved issue

items.input: Show me all open issues assigned to me.
items.expected_output: List of open issues assigned to the user displayed.
items.context: User wants to see their assigned work

items.input: Create a new label called 'tech debt' with a gray color.
items.expected_output: New label 'tech debt' with gray color created.
items.context: User wants to create a custom label for categorization

items.input: Replace all labels on this issue with 'enhancement' and 'backend'.
items.context: User wants to completely change the labels on an issue

items.input: Check if this user can be assigned to issues in this repo and assign them.
items.expected_output: User assignment checked and assigned to issue.
items.context: User wants to verify permissions before assigning

items.input: Compare the last two commits on the main branch and show what changed.
items.expected_output: Comparison of last two commits on main branch shown.
items.context: User wants to see recent changes to main branch

items.input: Find which branches contain this specific commit.
items.expected_output: Branches containing the specific commit listed.
items.context: User wants to know where a commit exists

items.input: Fork cal.com repository to my account and add aryanranderiya as a collaborator.
items.context: User wants to fork and set up collaboration
